dt: {bc}the act or process of {d_link|resolving|resolve:1}: such as
{bc}the act of analyzing a complex notion into simpler ones

{bc}the passing of a voice part from a {d_link|dissonant|dissonant} to a {d_link|consonant|consonant:1} tone or the progression of a chord from {d_link|dissonance|dissonance} to {d_link|consonance|consonance}
{bc}the separating of a chemical compound or mixture into its {d_link|constituents|constituent:1}
{bc}the division of a {d_link|prosodic|prosodic} element into its component parts
{bc}the substitution in Greek or Latin {d_link|prosody|prosody} of two short syllables for a long syllable
{bc}the analysis of a {d_link|vector|vector:1} into two or more vectors of which it is the sum
{bc}the subsidence of a {d_link|pathological|pathological} state (such as inflammation)

dt.t: made a {wi}resolution{/wi} to mend my ways

dt: {bc}a formal expression of opinion, will, or intent voted by an official body or assembled group
{bc}the point in a literary work at which the chief dramatic {d_link|complication|complication} is worked out
{bc}the process or capability of making distinguishable the individual parts of an object, closely adjacent optical images, or sources of light

{bc}a measure of the sharpness of an image or of the fineness with which a device (such as a video display, printer, or scanner) can produce or record such an image usually expressed as the total number or density of {d_link|pixels|pixel} in the image

pt: {sc}courage{/sc} {sc}mettle{/sc} {sc}spirit{/sc} {sc}resolution{/sc} {sc}tenacity{/sc} mean mental or moral strength to resist opposition, danger, or hardship. {sc}courage{/sc} implies firmness of mind and will in the face of danger or extreme difficulty.
{sc}mettle{/sc} suggests an ingrained capacity for meeting strain or difficulty with fortitude and resilience.

pt.t: a challenge that will test your {it}mettle{/it}

pt: {sc}spirit{/sc} also suggests a quality of temperament enabling one to hold one's own or keep up one's morale when opposed or threatened.
{sc}resolution{/sc} stresses firm determination to achieve one's ends.
{sc}tenacity{/sc} adds to {sc}resolution{/sc} implications of stubborn persistence and unwillingness to admit defeat.

pt.t: held to their beliefs with great {it}tenacity{/it}

quotes.t: In June, the demagogic militia leader Moqtada al Sadr … sponsored a {qword}resolution{/qword} requiring the government to seek permission of the parliament before asking the U.N. to reauthorize the presence of foreign forces in Iraq.

In late August, the U.N. Security Council passed a {qword}resolution{/qword} calling for peacekeepers to deploy to Darfur to stop a genocide that has claimed some 400,000 lives over the last three years.

Here again it would seem that the vicarious experience just once of seeing another human being completely "blotto" should be sufficient to engender a firm and unbreakable {qword}resolution{/qword} never to take a chance on making a similarly disgusting spectacle of oneself.
But Hannah's brief {qword}resolution{/qword} suddenly gave way, and all at once she clung to Kit, sobbing like a child.
Perrotta tells a good story in a top-shelf romance kind of way, and you'll very likely find yourself eager to get to the {qword}resolution{/qword} once you've begun.

The OMEGA spectrometer on the European Space Agency's Mars Express orbiter has gone where no spectrometer has gone before, covering near-infrared wavelengths and offering 10 times the {qword}resolution{/qword} of earlier instruments.
The new revelation was that, in high {qword}resolution{/qword}, the valley showed deep channels and scours sharply incised into bedrock …

et: Middle English {it}resolucioun{/it}, from Anglo-French or Latin; Anglo-French {it}resolucion{/it}, from Latin {it}resolution-, resolutio{/it}, from {it}resolvere{/it} {dx_ety}see {dxt|resolve:1||}{/dx_ety}
shortdef: the act or process of resolving: such as
the act of analyzing a complex notion into simpler ones

dt: {bc}a resolution passed by both houses of a legislative body that lacks the force of law

shortdef: a resolution passed by both houses of a legislative body that lacks the force of law

dt: {bc}a resolution passed by both houses of a legislative body that has the force of law when signed by or passed over the veto of the executive

shortdef: a resolution passed by both houses of a legislative body that has the force of law when signed by or passed over the veto of the executive

dt: {bc}a promise to do something differently in the new year

dt.t: Her {it}New Year's resolution{/it} is to exercise regularly.

shortdef: a promise to do something differently in the new year
